admission_text:
## Membership Benefits:

## Join the preservationists that came before you in becoming 

## a member of our 88+ year old preservation non-profit today!

[Become a Member](http://web.archive.org/web/20221201180542/https://gardenia-bird-xw5a.squarespace.com/checkout/donate?donatePageId=5f247205743e2602d9a3894b)

​

  1. ### Free unlimited admission to all four of our historic house museums

  2. ### Special members-only events (geared toward each level of giving)

  3. ### Priority access to our general public events, including free or discounted tickets

  4. ### Special members-only offers from our PhilaLandmarks’ partners: Hidden City Philadelphia, Cliveden, Historical Society of Pennsylvania, Philadelphia Opera Collaborative, Ghost Tours of Philadelphia (and more!)

  5. ### Recognition in our Annual Report 

  6. ### All applications will be reviewed by the staff, and may be recommended to the Board of Trustees for potential election to membership

### 

### 

$25 Young Friend: benefits for one individual 39 years or younger

$50 Individual: benefits for one individual

$85 Family: benefits for 2 adults and all children 17 & under

$100 Sustainer: benefits for 2 adults + guest privileges (2) for access to all 

PhilaLandmarks houses + all NARM benefits ([http://narmassociation.org](http://web.archive.org/web/20221201180542/http://narmassociation.org/)) giving you access to 900 arts, cultural, and historical institutions and more! 

[Become a Member today!](http://web.archi...
collections_text:
## Medical Drama. Great Wealth. Madeira.

### HILL-PHYSICK HOUSE

Physick House

press to zoom

Physick Jefferson Windows from Delancey Street

press to zoom

Physick Wisteria

press to zoom

Dr. Physick's Soda

press to zoom

Physick Entry Way

press to zoom

Neoclassical Decor

press to zoom

Piano Forte

press to zoom

Dr. Physick's Instruments

press to zoom

Master Bedroom

press to zoom

Show More

Built in 1786, this square, four-story brick house is the only free-standing Federal townhouse remaining in Society Hill. With its huge doorway fan light (the largest in any Pennsylvania residence in 1786) plus grand proportions and straight, classical lines, Physick House is an exceptional example of the Federal style. It is decorated with outstanding examples of French-influenced Neoclassic furnishings, popular during Dr. Physick's time in the house. The unusually large city garden also contains plants popular in the 19th century.

The house remained in the family, passing through various relations of Dr. Physick. Philip Syng Physick Randolph I sold the property to Elise Wister Keith in 1895. Elise and her husband Charles Penrose Keith lived in the house until their deaths (in 1938 & 1940). The house is also referred to as the Hill/Physick/Keith House. 

[](http://web.archive.org/web/20221201165801/https://roundme.com/tour/195802/view/520308/)

## LOCATION

321 South 4th Street  
Philadelphia, PA 19106
